definition: row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: The students were parading for peace.
sentences.chinese: 學生們示威遊行，要求和平。

sentences.english: The speaker incited the mob to demonstrate against the rising cost of living.
sentences.chinese: 演說者鼓動羣衆示威遊行，抗議生活費高漲。

sentences.english: President Bush is often the target of anti-American demonstrations.
sentences.chinese: 布什總統常是反美示威遊行的目標。
沒人資助這些示威遊行。

sentences.english: There were daily strikes and demonstrations, and buildings were on fire.
sentences.chinese: 每天都有罷工和示威遊行，而建築物都着火了。

sentences.english: The police were present at the demonstration in (full) force.
sentences.chinese: 警方派出大隊人馬在示威遊行的現場戒備。

sentences.english: For the past two weekends, anti-Chinese protesters have demonstrated in Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 在過去兩週的週末，越南各地都有反中國的示威遊行。

sentences.english: These were among the largest demonstrations since the 18-day revolution in January and February.
sentences.chinese: 這18天以來，在一月和二月革命的最大的示威遊行。

sentences.english: The protests were the largest antiterrorist demonstrations in history.
sentences.chinese: 抗議活動是歷史上最大的反恐怖示威遊行。

sentences.english: It is the first serious clash after weeks of mass protests.
sentences.chinese: 這是在大規模示威遊行數週後的第一次嚴重武力衝突。

sentences.english: There were also anti-Chinese demonstrations in Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 越南還發生了反華示威遊行。

definition: 38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zhong1 xin1

definition: a tax declaration form/a tax return
forced labor (as punishment in criminal case)
fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
Ruyuan Yao Autonomous County in Shaoguan 韶關|韶关[Shao2 guan1], Guangdong

pinyin: Bei3 Ka3 luo2 lai2 na4 zhou1
